storyInfo: Zuo Le taps into power borrowed from Dusk to seal Ji inside a painting scroll, hoping to force the main suspect to submit. At the same time, the contamination within Dahuang has reached a tipping point, threatening to spiral out of control.

attributes.content: You're leaving again?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: You're not going to try to talk me out of it this time?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: When have you ever listened?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: I'll feel empty inside if you don't at least nag a little bit.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I can still walk, and my limbs remain sturdy. The spring wind is still chilly, so it's not like I can sunbathe in my chair.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: You know how dangerous it is up north.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: But, Shu... You also know we have no choice...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: It took us decades just to carve out this little plot of land. But, it's still not enough.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: We're always short on food and land... If we go a bit further north, we might just find some special crops that can grow in Originium-tainted soil.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Then, we'd be able to cultivate the entire continent, and nobody would go hungry ever again.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Even more reason for you to stay.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: If we can't find a crop like that, we'll just cultivate slowly. It might take ten generations, or a hundred, but eventuallyâ€“
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Does it look like I can wait that long?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Besides, if the others heard things like 'crops that can be grown in Originium-tainted soil' or 'cultivating the entire continent,' they'd think I lost my mind.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: There's no arguing with you.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Wisdom is one of the perks that comes with age.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: The woman extends her hand, her fingers tightly clenched.
Oh, Shu... Would you mind reading my palm again? See if this old lady still has the luck to realize her dreams this late in life?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I already told you, I'm not doing that anymore.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: The woman smiles and unclasps her hand, revealing a small white flower in the middle of her palm. She pins the flower to the hair bun of the girl in front of her.
I found this in the fields today. I do believe it's the first flower to bloom this year, and that's surely a good omen.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Maybe I'll make it back in time for this year's harvest.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: You just keep track of the days, and have some short-rib soup ready for me.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.text: You've always been able to see that future, haven't you?
No... Don't tell me. I don't want to know when I'll die.
Will our dream of The Ten Thousand Qing of Fertile Fields come true?

attributes.content: Tianshi...
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: Shu?
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: You've been loitering around here all morning. You don't wanna give up on this piece of land, do you?
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: Right...
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: The mountains are lush, the water is clear, and the food's good too... I like it here a lot.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Tianshi Shu, you were transferred to Dahuang not too long ago, right? You look very young.
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: I've been here since I was born. Sixty-seven now... In all my years, I never thought I'd see the day when I had to leave.
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: It's said that more than a thousand years have passed since Shennong reclaimed this land. How could we just...
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: Just as crops are planted in spring and harvested in autumn, one cannot hope to evade the elements forever. It is the way of the world for things to go wrong, and we can only let nature run its course.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: When you move to a nomadic city, everyone will have something to do. Trust that the proper arrangements have been made.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: We just don't understand... We thought our harvest has been weak the past two years because of the weather. It's nothing we can't overcome with a bit of hard work.
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: But now, you're telling us there's something wrong with the land itself... Shu, you Tianshis are wiser than us. Can't you please think of a way to save this land?
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: Just tell us what we have to do. It doesn't matter how hard we have to work, even if it means tilling every last clump of soilâ€“
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: It rained just two days ago, so how come this land is...?
attributes.name: Tired Farmer

attributes.content: The farmer standing at the edge of the field suddenly goes wide-eyed.

All the water stored in the fields drains away at a speed discernable to the naked eye, as if there is a bottomless abyss hidden beneath the land. In a flash, all the water is gone, and along with it, the life of the land.
The moist paddy fields turn to hardened salt flats in an instant, countless parched fissures stretching outward.
Stop right there.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Lord Zuo.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Where do you think you're going?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: I've delivered what I needed to deliver, and seen the people I needed to see. And so, it's time for me to leaveâ€” Why, have you come to see me off, Lord Zuo?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: You can't leave yet. Not until you've given me an explanation.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: First, the Sui Regulator tells me to go, then it tells me that I have to stay... You'll have to forgive me for not being able to keep my orders straight.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: What's your involvement with the demonic taint that's appeared in the middle of Dahuang, and what plans do you have for the devices in the core city?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: What's more... A hundred years ago, a particular convict escaped from the capital, and in just a few months, his pawns were all across Great Yan. What have you been doing in that time?!
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: I can't fathom what you're trying to say.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Then, I'll simply have to escort you to a place where I can make things clear to you.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: The fact that you came here alone shows great bravery, Lord Zuo. If not for the fact that I'm short on time, I'd be more than glad to stay and chat with such a promising young man.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: But... What if I choose not to play along?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: The man takes out a jade weaver's shuttle. Aside from its extra-delicate appearance, nothing about it seems out of the ordinary.
Zuo Le takes notice of the gossamer threads wrapped faintly around it.
Stop right thereâ€“â€“!
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Hmm...?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: The shock is only momentary.
Before the man can lift the shuttle in his hand, the Candleholder's blade is already at his neck.
I'm just an ordinary man. I don't have the power to fight against you proxies...
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: But within this scroll, there is no difference between the two of us.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: This scroll... is one of my sister's...
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: How could a mortal dare to harness this power?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Perhaps you underestimated the extent to which the Feranmutologists have researched you... The Sui Regulator is fully aware of each and every one of your abilities.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: I never expected Dusk to have such a low opinion of me, that she'd rather team up with a Candleholder to make my life difficult...
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: But, is it not a crime for a Candleholder to come into private contact with a proxy? As guilty as you already are, Lord Zuo, have you not considered the consequences of such an outrageous act?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: The most important thing is for me to stop you right here... and bring you into custody.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: You drew the demonic taint into Dahuang in order to destroy the Twelve Pagodas and Five Cities?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Was this entire incident orchestrated by that particular convict?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: And if I were to say yes, what then?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: What are you going to do about it, Lord Zuo?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Kill me right here and now, granting the Sui beneath the capital city even greater consciousness? Is Yan really prepared to march to war?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: If that's what it takes to stop you, then so be it. Even now, the bestial Sui may not stand as a shield for the misdeeds of your kind.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Nevertheless, it is still a trade whose value must be weighed.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: The man smiles, ignoring the long blade pointed at his neck. He dusts off his robe and finds a stone step to sit on.
I'm seriousâ€“â€“
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Why so jittery? Now that I've been sealed within this painting, I am a simple tailor without the ability to so much as capture a fowlbeast. What, are you worried I'll fly away?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: We rarely get such opportunities, so let's chat.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: The only thing you'll be doing is answering my questions.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Are you not at all curious about the files in the library that you don't have the authorization to access?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Such a great opportunity is sitting right here. Surely, those questions are of much more interest to you?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Don't try to talk your way out of this...
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Then, let's settle the account.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Between Great Yan, and the Feranmuts.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: ...The trail's gone cold?
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: If these demon-tainted seeds floated over from that river, then why do the traces of contamination get fainter the closer we go to the edge of the city...?
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: Could it be...?
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: She scoops up a handful of sand and twirls it carefully within her palm, her brow knitting together.
The newly-built nomadic city in the distance undulates as it sends faint vibrations through the earth, like a continuous mountain range or the bulging back of a gargantuan beast.

Steel and concrete prop up soil that is thousands of years old, the massive structure seemingly erecting a bridge that spans the ages. But, who knows of the vestiges left upon this land across its myriad epochs?
Was this your doing?
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: All these years, you've been silently suppressing this demonic presence... What are you after?
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: How could there be any Xian like you...?
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: Lord Zuo, have you ever seen a silkworm? Or perhaps, heard the idiom: 'to wrap yourself in your own cocoon'?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: What are you getting at?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: I'm quite familiar with these things.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: For these creatures to grow, they must endure a calamity. Those that survive will break out of their cocoons; those that do not will have their lives quietly snuffed out in the darkness.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Who are you implying is the silkworm here?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: You and I, and all things in existence.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Say what you will, but we have no interest in comparing ourselves to insects.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: You people are so proud of the civilization you've built, but are there no records of the very beginning in the Sui Regulator's files? Of how the True Lung was able to end the Hundred Clan Rebellion?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Of course we're aware. We understand full well that it was nothing more than a bout of folly brought about by the bestial Sui's arrogance, not a gift of any sort. Why, are you that keen for Yan to sing the praises of your kind?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Besides, you no longer have that kind of power.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: No living being can escape the cycle of destruction and rebirth. Summer insects sing not of sleet or ice. Everything we see, hear, and think is enclosed in a silken cocoon, and we must never forget our humility.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: What are you getting at?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Since the end of that great battle and the appearance of our kind, the Sui Regulator has also accumulated a thousand years of history.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Have you ever considered why Yan never moved to banish the Sui, until now?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: A hundred years ago, the convict incited great chaos, resulting in the death of a proxy. Now that the awakening of the bestial Sui is an inevitability, banishment has become a clear imperative.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: The bestial Sui is awakening? Which Feranmutologist came up with that conclusion?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Who stands to benefit when Yan goes to war? In whose interest would it be to banish the Sui?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Did you fail to consider these questions, Lord Zuo, or are you simply pretending that they don't exist?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Why should I take anything you say at face value...?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Naturally, you don't have to believe me. Let us settle another account.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Setting aside the fact that I am a lowly peddler, my brothers and sisters have for centuries kept a great many dangers from Great Yan.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Even when it comes to my 'unemployed' little sister, Yan cannot even fathom the amount of effort it would've taken to build its nomadic cities without her.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Of course, there's also the sister who has been standing guard here all this time.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: When it comes to the symbiotic history of the Feranmuts and Yan, from beginning to end, my brothers and sisters have done nothing to harm you. All they've wanted is to live like ordinary people.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: But now, they are about to lose their lives over some undeserved disaster... Tell me, Lord Zuo, how are we to settle this account?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Indeed, a number of you have made invaluable contributions to Yan, which the nation has never forgotten.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Yet now, there are some of you who choose to stand against Great Yan, threatening the lives of countless people.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Ah, were you not suggesting just now that your Xians had taken good care of Yan? Why then, at the first sign of hardship, do you turn against the Xians?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Where even are these Xians? From beginning to end, there have only been ordinary people.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Why not take a look at the ground beneath your own feet?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Didn't we already dispose of the contaminated crops...?
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: No, no... This is the grain that was harvested normally before. How did it become like this...?
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: The granary is filled with the rice that was harvested only a few days ago.
What should have been a golden mound of grain has now turned into a red-and-black mass.
